intro: Senecio flabellatus, commonly known as the Flapjack Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, gray-green leaves arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
